intro: Diplocrater, commonly known as the horned violets, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Violaceae. These plants are characterized by their distinctive, often hairy leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. They are typically found in moist, woodland habitats across temperate regions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value. Diplocrater species are generally perennial and have a compact growth habit.
